ImageData.LabelName: Primary tumor is 5 cm or smaller
Cancer in lymph nodes in lung or near bronchus

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Adjusted the eyes/gaze so that they're at a similar angle as the LungStage1A image; removed facial hair over the trachea anatomy
Deleted the items relating to “a”, “b”, and “c” on the image per expert reviewer
Added a fork to the line that points to the lymph nodes with cancer so that one fork is pointing to the group of lymph nodes with cancer in the lung

Changed the wording in the top left inset to say “Primary tumor is 5 cm or smaller”; removed the line from the label Diaphragm that is pointing to the back of the diaphragm; and added a label for Pleura above the Diaphragm label.
Removed the “c.” in front of the label “Part of all of the lung collapsed” and added “or has pneumonitis”

Changed title to Stage IIB Lung Cancer (1); took off the clear-looking covering on the diaphragm; removed the letter “a” from the top inset; changed the letter ”b” in the main figure to “a” and moved it up above where the bronchus goes into the lung; removed the letter “b” from the main figure; changed the letter “d” to “b”; changed the letter “e” to “c”; moved the label “Right main bronchus” to the other side of the figure and changed it to “Main bronchus” with lines that point to both the right and the left bronchus; moved the label “Cancer in lymph nodes in lung or near bronchus” up under the top inset; labeled the Lung on the right side of the figure; and removed the label for Bronchioles.
Separated Stage IIB Lung Cancer into two images, part 1 and part 2
Revisions made to image per AJCC 8th edition staging

Diagnoses.Diagnosis: stage IIB non-small cell lung cancer

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Stage IIB lung cancer (1); drawing shows a primary tumor (5 cm or smaller) in the right lung and cancer in lymph nodes in the same lung as the primary tumor. Also shown are the trachea, main bronchus, pleura, and diaphragm.

Stage IIB lung cancer (1); drawing shows a primary tumor (5 cm or smaller) in the right lung and cancer in lymph nodes in the same lung as the primary tumor. Also shown are the trachea, main bronchus, pleura, and diaphragm.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage IIB lung cancer (1). The primary tumor is 5 centimeters or smaller and cancer has spread to the lymph nodes on the same side of the chest as the primary tumor. The lymph nodes with cancer are in the lung or near the bronchus.

Stage IIB lung cancer (1). The primary tumor is 5 centimeters or smaller and cancer has spread to the lymph nodes on the same side of the chest as the primary tumor. The lymph nodes with cancer are in the lung or near the bronchus.

ProposedUse.Glossary: stage IIB non-small cell lung cancer

ProcessingStatus.ProcessingStatusValue: Approved by expert reviewer with changes
